summary: The user engaged the assistant to optimize the project constitution file, CLAUDE.md. Despite an initial internal analysis suggesting redundancy was beneficial for instruction weighting, the user provided external counter-arguments which led to a successful cleanup, reducing the file size by 62% by removing implementation details. The session concluded with an analysis of how the optimized file adheres to specific behavior-first goals.
key_decisions: Optimized CLAUDE.md by removing implementation details and structural redundancy
Established that code-based DRY principles do apply to implementation noise in prompts
Reduced CLAUDE.md from 856 lines to 325 lines
